newsitem.title: USA: Virginia Port Authority plans $70 mln bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Virginia Port Authority plans $70 mln bond issue.

text.p: Virginia Port Authority plans to issue at least $70 million of revenue bonds in about a month, Finance Director Oliver Daughdrill said Wednesday.
PaineWebber Inc is senior manager for the deal, which may be expanded to $117 million to defease about $18 million worth of authority debt issued in 1993.
Daughdrill said the defeasance was being considered because the earlier debt was subject to outdated restrictions that have proved cumbersome.
Additionally, he said, "If the interest rates stay the same, we'll probably pick up some savings there."
Daughdrill said the authority would decide by next week whether to include the defeasance in the deal.
The new money part of the deal will finance land and equipment purchases for the authority's three ports in Norfolk, Newport News and Portsmouth.
Debt service is to be paid via the Virginia National Terminals, the nonprofit corporation that collects fees at the various ports.
The authority's last debt issue was a $38.3 million bond issue that closed in November.
